job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Covington, LA

review_title: IT dept - Great co-workers but horrible advancement opportunities.
job_title: Technical Support Analyst in Covington, LA
pros:
Great co-workers
Ok benefits
Ok starting salary 
Great entry level experience
Discount on lunch - RIP Taco Tuesday!
cons:
There are no opportunities to advance your career in the IT dept.  (I left because of THIS). There are several hard-working individuals on the service desk team that most certainly deserve a chance to advance their careers in the IT dept. Unfortunately, the CIO of the IT dept at St. Tammany sees otherwise and does not see the true value of the technical support team. There are service desk team members that are doing other job duties but are not getting the title recognition or pay they deserve. Longevity also plays a part in this and several members of the service desk team have been there for a number of years with no respect given and no advancement opportunities. 

On-call pay should be higher
Starting wage should be higher
Raises NEED to get better
Management could advance career minded folks (especially on the service desk team)  
Bring back merit raises to hard-working individuals
Give correct title and job description

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technologist in Covington, LA
pros: Job security, fast growing department
cons: Very busy, frequently short staffed

job_title: Creative Design Specialist in Covington, LA
pros: I have worked for St. Tammany Parish Hospital for 20 years, collectively. I left for about 9 months and came back as soon as I could. Working for St. Tammany Parish Hospital is like having an extended family. We care about each other, our patients and their families, all of our visitors. We have an amazing Environmental Services department that takes GREAT pride in keeping our hospital clean. Taking pride in where you work and what you do is must! I recommend this hospital as an amazing place to work and the only choice for healthcare on the Northshore! We have GREAT benefits and keeping employees healthy is very important our Administration. We are looking for ways to continue 'being the best', as an employee we have a say in that, and our opinions are valued.
cons: I would say parking, but our leaders have already taken steps to fix that. Umm, this is a tough question. I could say we stay pretty busy, but that seems like more of a blessing than a con. I give up!

review_title: Used to be a great place....
pros: Technology and equipment is up to date and makes nursing easier. The doctors are phenomenal! The nursing staff is one of the most caring and educated I have ever worked with. Very professional environment.
cons: Administration has thrown nurses to the wolves. It didn't used to be like this. Our salaries are no longer competitive... They don't staff adequately and are not filling positions as nurses leave to go to higher paying hospitals. Assignments are getting larger and there is no incentive to work extra to ensure adequate staffing. No raise last year. Now they extended raised to every year + 1 quarter. We are not getting quality nurses and the nurses we have are overworked and underpaid. We used to be full but the patients are going elsewhere. Very very sad!!

review_title: STPH is a great place to work!
pros: There is a great focus on employee satisfaction at STPH balanced with patient and physician satisfaction.  Once your foot is in the door, you can certainly put down roots and plan to retire with STPH, if you want to.  The hospital offers many education opportunities to advance your career.  The benefits are great in comparison to other employers in the area.  Clinical employees seem to be the happiest in their jobs.
cons: Some of the departments with entry-level positions can be a challenge to work for, but the right people with the right attitude will have opportunities to move up in the company.

job_title: Director of Communication in Covington, LA
pros: In public relations, you have to carefully choose your employer (or clients in agency). You're putting your reputation and integrity on the line to represent this brand to the public. In my 25-year career, St. Tammany Parish Hospital is, hands down, my favorite employer or client. I am always proud to say I represent the hospital, to talk about its programs, and most of all, to tell people about the exceptional staff who deliver care there.
cons: We're a fast-growing facility in a fast-growing region of the country. That is a strength in many ways, but it can also mean that we all have to be nimble and ready to adjust to new challenges quickly.

review_title: i enjoyed my time working there, and learned more then i was excepting.
pros: The co-workers were like family to me, and we all got along with each other. When you needed help they were always there to help. If i needed certain times off for personal emergencies they were always very understanding. And the best thing i remember about them was that our very top priority was the safety and car for our patients.
cons: Working under a lot of stress was only the main problem working there. But once you got everything under control, the stress usually calmed down.

pros: It was pretty much different every day, due to the patients. The benefits were pretty good. Good group of people to work with.
cons: If working Trash and Linen, it was lots of walking and sometimes dealing with soiled linen or overstuffed bags of linen. Long drive. Pay was terrible.
